wdpar
  • Reference
  • Articles

Combine or union feature geometries (parallelized)

Combine several feature geometries into one, with or without resolving internal boundaries

st_parallel_union(x, threads = 1)

Arguments

x

object of class sf, sfc or sfg
threads

integer number of threads for processing data. Defaults to 1.

Value

A single geometry sfc object with resolved boundaries.

Details

This function is essentially just a wrapper for st_union. See the documentation for st_union for more information.

Examples

# load data
nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"))
#> Reading layer `nc' from data source `/home/jeff/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/3.4/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
#> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields
#> geometry type:  MULTIPOLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965
#> epsg (SRID):    4267
#> proj4string:    +proj=longlat +datum=NAD27 +no_defs

# create unioned data
ncu <- st_parallel_union(nc, threads = 1)

# plot data for visual comparison
par(mfrow = c(1, 2))
plot(sf::st_geometry(nc), main = "original data", col = "white")
plot(ncu, main = "unioned data", col = "white")
